body:
Nifty idea to solve the problem with the checkboxes 💪 

As this method is "just" returning `true` or `false`, once could make things even more obvious by renaming it to
```ruby
conference_exists_for?(team)
```

Plus, this is more of a personal preference things: I really **love** the lonely operator, but I think it this case it confuses about what's actually happening in the method. I myself am also not 100% sure if I get you intend here. I'll try to break it down:
```ruby
def conference_existsts_for?(team)
  conference_preference = team.conference_preference
  return false unless conference_preference.persisted? # you want to have the method return false if the team did not yet create a `ConferencePreferences`?
  [
    conference_preference.first_conference_id,
    conference_preference.second_conference_id
  ].any? # you want to know wether there are any values for either of the conference IDs...?
end
